intro: Agrostophyllum leytense, commonly known as the Leyte grass or Leyte silvergrass, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Poaceae, which includes grasses, and is characterized by its slender, tufted growth habit. The plant features narrow, silver-gray leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. It typically grows in moist, coastal areas and is adapted to sandy or rocky soils. Agrostophyllum leytense is of interest to botanists and conservationists due to its limited distribution and unique ecological role in its native habitat.
